workshops.title: Intro to Electrical Engineering
workshops.description: Taught by Amador’s award-winning AVBotz robotics team, this workshop will introduce students to foundational electrical engineering topics like current, voltage, and power. Students will gain hands-on experience with real circuits, soldering, and prototyping on circuit boards.

workshops.title: Computer Vision with OpenCV
workshops.description: Explore how to process images and video using OpenCV in Python to detect motion, shapes, and objects. This workshop demonstrates how computer vision allows robots, drones, and self-driving cars to analyze their surroundings and avoid obstacles.

workshops.title: Intro to CAD Using OnShape
workshops.description: Step into the world of 3D design and learn how engineers and makers turn ideas into prototypes and real products. In this workshop, taught by Amador's award-winning AVBotz robotics team, students will use Onshape (onshape.com) to create 3D parts and simple assemblies while learning core CAD skills like sketching, constraints, and extruding.

workshops.title: Mechanical Plane Design & Manufacturing
workshops.description: Step into the world of aerospace engineering and learn how to create planes. In this workshop, taught by Amador’s award-winning AmadorUAVs team, students will explore modern manufacturing technologies like CNCs, laser cutters, and 3D printers. This workshop will also explore the usage of ANSYS Fluent CFD to visualize and simulate aerodynamics, concluding with a hands-on activity where students build and test their own small gliders.

workshops.title: Drone Power Systems
workshops.description: Unlock the secrets of flight in this hands-on workshop. Learn fundamental electronics, explore the anatomy of a drone and basic systems and electronics. Run by Amador's award-winning UAVs club, the workshop will have live demonstrations, and we'll explain the controls for a real flight experience using our own hand-built drone.

workshops.title: Build and Code Cyberbots
workshops.description: In this hands-on workshop, students become robotics engineers as they build Cyberbots, learn the basics of coding their movements, and put their skills to the test by programming them to escape a maze. Taught by AVHS Girls Who Code, perfect for all experience levels!

workshops.title: Robot Tour Using EV3
workshops.description: Learn about the Science Olympiad Robot Tour event through the LEGO MINDSTORMS EV3 platform. This technical workshop focuses on the engineering principles and  logic to build a competitive robot. Learn Hands-on assembly of EV3 components, Sensor Calibration, and Autonomous Programming.

workshops.title: Intro to Data Science
workshops.prereqs: Basic Python or coding experience recommended
workshops.description: This workshop will integrate computer science and statistics to teach students various data analysis techniques. Students will learn to use Jupyter Notebook and Python libraries, such as Pandas and Scikit Learn, to explore large datasets and uncover insightful patterns. These skills are highly applicable to the real world, most notably for building Large Language Models that train on terabytes of data.

workshops.title: Applications of Machine Learning
workshops.description: Explore the rapidly growing field of Machine Learning with real-world examples in market prediction and AI. Students will build Long-Short-Term-Memory (LSTM) models in Python to predict stock market prices while learning core artificial intelligence tools.

workshops.title: Intro to Python
workshops.description: Python is one of the most popular and powerful programming languages—used in AI, data analysis, automation, and more. This beginner workshop introduces core concepts with no prerequisites, making it perfect for first-time coders who want to build their future with code.

workshops.title: Intro to Java
workshops.description: Java is one of the most popular programming languages, powering everything from popular apps and game servers to large-scale backends used by real companies. In this beginner-friendly workshop, students will learn core programming concepts like variables, conditionals, loops, methods, and an introduction to object oriented programming (OOP). No prior experience is required. Students planning to take AP Computer Science A in high school will also get a strong head start from this workshop.

workshops.title: Server Building
workshops.description: Ever wanted to host your own website or run a file server? Learn how to build and configure your own server from scratch. Students will gain experience in Linux system administration as we install and set up applications like a code-server and Minecraft server. This hands-on workshop is perfect for tech enthusiasts! Students should bring a Windows or MacOS (non-Chromebook) laptop for this workshop.

workshops.title: Intro to Web Development
workshops.description: Want to build your own website from scratch? This beginner-friendly course introduces HTML, CSS, and JavaScript—the foundation of websites. Students will create interactive, responsive websites. No past coding experience is required!
